oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photograph of three ladies visiting the grave of Pvt. Frank M. Ring, Co. A, 114th MG Battn., 30th Div.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The Ring family of Franklin, Tennessee provided three of their four sons to World War I. The third oldest, Pvt. Frank M. Ring, Co. A, 114th MG Battn., 30th Div., was killed on October 9, 1918 and buried at the Somme American Cemetery. This photograph shows three ladies visiting his grave. The ladies were friends of his older brother, Capt. Joseph Jasper Ring, who served in the 308th Engineers. The ladies are related to one of Jasper Ring's co-workers at Allis Chalmers Company.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
